title: Cabinet Repairs
subtitle: A quick and easy fix for faded Grand Design cabinets
intro: If you happen to own a Grand Design Imagine with the dark cabinetry, you may have noticed color fading anywhere water tends to drip. We ran into the same issue — but found a super simple fix you can store right inside your RV.

sections.heading: What We Noticed
paragraphs: Pretty much anywhere that water has a chance to drip, the cabinet finish tends to fade or lose color. This is especially noticeable around sinks, bathrooms, and under the kitchen counter.
Ours started developing these light, worn-looking spots that made the cabinetry look older than it really was.

sections.heading: The Easy Fix: Minwax Stain Marker
paragraphs: We found a simple solution that’s inexpensive, easy to store in the RV, and quick to apply — the **Minwax Stain Marker in Ebony**.
It goes on smoothly and blends right into the dark cabinetry finish. Honestly, it’s so easy to use that even a kid could do it!

sections.heading: The Results
paragraphs: After applying the stain marker, the faded spots blended right in and the cabinets looked so much better. It took just a few minutes, dried quickly, and made a noticeable difference.
Minwax also makes a clear coat pen, which might be worth adding afterward to seal in the color and help prevent future fading.

images.caption: Applying the Minwax Ebony stain marker - It’s so easy to use, even a kid can do it!
Here’s what they look like after…. much better!

quote: It’s amazing how such a small fix can make the cabinets look like new again.
noteBox: If your Grand Design cabinets are fading, this is an easy upgrade that takes only minutes and costs under $10.
